title: Anderson Building
text:
The Anderson Building is a historic building located at 701 South 24th Street in <a href="Omaha%2C%20Nebraska">Omaha, Nebraska</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is a <a href="Sullivanesque">Sullivanesque</a> style building erected in 1924.
History.
The building was listed on the U.S. <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> on November 20, 2009. It "stands as a textbook example of the Sullivanesque design principals as promoted by the Midland Terra Cotta Company."
The listing was announced as the featured listing in the <a href="National%20Park%20Service">National Park Service</a>'s weekly list of November 27, 2009.
The building meets criteria assessed in the MPD study titled "Apartments, Flats and Tenements in Omaha, Nebraska from 1880-1962".
